Like the yellow umbrella during the Umbrella Movement in Hong Kong, Affective Aestheticism is used in protests to convey messages to the public more effectively than words or actions. It provides a medium for messages, movements, unity among the protestors, and a symbol of value.

The symbol of yellow umbrellas vastly spread throughout Hong Kong during the Umbrella Movement in 2014. The yellow umbrella was broadly recognized as a symbol of the Umbrella Movement and demonstrators frequently used it as a notebook for writing statements and drawing images.
